Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Unhappy Staff”
Reviews.Author: anamericaninr0me
Reviews.Content: Meh. That sums up our hotel experience. We were at Hotel Ingles at a low time of year and were given a room away from the street. The street is quite popular, but we had no problem with noise. We went as a couple, but were given a room with 3 single beds. Spacious enough, but not exactly the sleeping situation we counted on. The locations is really convenient for all of the museums and sites. We only took the metro to/from the airport. We walked everywhere else. After living in Italy for some time, I have a bit of a thick skin when it comes to costumer service but man oh man. There will be no smiles here. It was the major downside of our stay. We were scared of the front desk! At least they were willing to keep our bags for us for a couple hours after we checked out. Very begrudgingly, of course.

Reviews.Title: “terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: wesjf
Reviews.Content: didn't even get to the hotel at the time of writing this, made a booking 2 weeks ago, due to arrive tomorrow and i receive an email to say my booking didn't go ahead, literally less than 24 hours before i get there. terrible communication by this hotel and its too late to sort somewhere else. definitely avoid if at all possible!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Apere096
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located close to Puerta Del Sol, which gives you walking access to all of Madrid's famous shops, bars, and attractions. The staff is a bit rude and not helpful, but that is an attitude all around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Lilian D
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Ingles in March 2011, it was overall good, the room was very spacious, it had plasma TV and basic amenities. It was a little updated because it is an old hotel, but it seemed cleaned and bed was comfortable. The only thing I did not like was the costumer service from receptionist (he had none) very rude, gave us wrong information twice and with an attitude all the time, really dislike him and he acted like he didnt care for his clients. The location is perfect in the middle of everything very close to the Puerta del Sol. Just one tip if you are coming from the airport by train, do not follow directions from the Hotel, we walked 5 blocks under the rain on the wrong direction, because the hotel gave us wrong info.

Reviews.Title: “excellent position”
Reviews.Author: Kiari
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location in the center, just steps from the Puerta del Sol and the Paseo El Prado. In the area there are many bars and restaurants. Because of the location, the rooms look down on the road are a bit noisy. The hotel is outdated. We stayed 4 nights in December and in the room was a little cold. A continental breakfast is basic. The price is good, I recommend this hotel for a budget stay a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Why are you trying to sleep? It's party time !!!”
Reviews.Author: Gorgonzillah
Reviews.Content: We picked Hotel Ingles after reading other trip advisor reviews, to stay a couple nights before spending a week on the Costa del Sol. We wanted a Hotel with a bathroom in the room, and some assurance of relatively sturdy walls (mostly in consideration of the neighbors; I am a world class snorer), without paying the same rate as for the Ritz.. We were pleasantly surprised when received a very generous bedroom with an attached drawing room overlooking the street; the bathroom was well appointed; and the queen sized bed was very firm. The location is great: It is a short walk downhill to the museums on the Paseo El Prado. Puerto Del Sol and the Plaza Mayor are also close by. There is a business center nearby on Plaza Canalejas if you need to check email or print boarding passes, or else the Starbucks has free internet (with purchase). The windows have security blinds, and the double doors between bedroom and drawing room could be closed to add reasonable protection against street noise. It was very quiet on a regular weekday night. However, the party atmosphere that developed in the Centro neighborhood on a warm Friday in April was both friendly and massive. We joined in and toured the neighborhoods, but returned to the hotel relatively early (after midnight), since we had a flight the next day. We do not hold the hotel responsible for the full throated men's chorus who was chucking empty bottles into metal bins at about 4:00 AM in the street. We recommend the hotel's standard continental breakfast. It is a positive pleasure to be able to pour a warm-up on your coffee. You might be able to find a lower priced meal at a nearby cafe, but you are more likely to spend twice as much on Madrid's equivalent of bacon, eggs, and hash browns, and your server wouldn't think of giving you seconds on your coffee. I would agree with a previous reviewer that the air conditioning is weak. - not to bad for April, but I couldn't say about August.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ddo63
Reviews.Content: Location was great, right in the centre, but very noisey at night, dispite the 2 x double glazlng. A bit shabby and could do with a make over but was clean and safe. Breakfast was very basic but all in all we were happy and got value for our 64 euros per night for a double room with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: AnaLuisa2
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ingles has a distinguished pedigree and a super location, but its current incarnation is a nightmare. Absolutely hostile staff. The mystery persons who write the hotel's emails never communicate with the front desk. The bathrooms in particular are coated with mold and have crumbling ceilings full of water damage. The showers spray horizontally out of the tub and onto the opposing wall. It's extremely run-down and in desperate need of a makeover. You're better off at one of the hostals around the Plaza de las Cortes.

Reviews.Title: “A slightly jewel from the past”
Reviews.Author: RichardCA
Reviews.Content: The hotel must have been a real gem when it opened those many decades ago. I stayed here three nights and was very comfortable the entire stay. A fantastic location with nightlife all around. It was less than 2 minutes walk to the Regus office facilities I used for busines. I probably wouldn't stay here in the summer as my room had no air-conditiong but I would stay at the Hotel Ingles again the other 7 or 8 months a year quite readily.

Reviews.Title: “Very unpleasent staff on great location”
Reviews.Author: m3103
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in really good location and it is placed in the real center of Madrid. You can walk to almoast every sight and it is hotel's advantage. Rooms need redecoration, specially bathrooms. Staff is very unpleasent, and not only one of them; 3 different guys on the reception were not helpful at all. Hey guys, you live from your guests, aren't you?! Probably wouldn't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: vtech1818
Reviews.Content: My brother and I are both in our mid 20's and stayed at Hotel Ingles for four nights in the beginning of August. The location is very convenient and close to a lot of the hot spots in Madrid. The hotel staff is very friendly and speak good English (if that's a concern for you). However, the beds are very creaky and the A/C in our room was pretty much non-existent which is a big concern in August. You cannot change the thermostat from 22C, but the room was never that cool. The air ran (while we were in the room because you have to insert your key to turn on the electricity meaning it never runs while you're gone), but it was not effective. I sweated profusely in my bed every night I was there. It is a relatively inexpensive hotel, but there are definitely no luxuries to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: bcroyal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March for 3 nights and for the money and location It couldn't be better. The room was huge and overlooked the street but this wasn't a problem but it could be noise wise in the height of the season. The hotel was very clean and the staff although giving the impression of being surly weren't and were helpful when asked. Sound did tend to echo a bit from the landings as the floors & walls were marble so sound resonated a bit. As I said location wise it is literally walking distance from the main squares and attractions and just outside has to be one of the best bars I've visited - La Venencia - a sherry bar - great

Reviews.Title: “Staff not friendly”
Reviews.Author: UlrichLehmannfuentes
Reviews.Content: We paid 100 Euro for 2 adults and two children, what is not too much for the center of madrid. The room was also very clean and the whole center is reachable by feet. I would give you the advice too ask for an written confirmation, that the price includes taxes, as we had to pay extra 7 Euro for each night. The Staff wasn´t very friendly. The bed were very noisy and the doors made a huge noise when people closed them.

Reviews.Title: “Like a good old friend...”
Reviews.Author: Christiaan v
Reviews.Content: It wasn't my first time in this hotel but it was good to see that it was still there after many tears. Solid, somewhat old fashioned but friendly in a rapidly changing Madrid. It has the perfect location near the 3 great museums and near the Plaza Santa Anna with its terraces. The breakfast, not included in the price of the rooms, is simple, but what can one expect for 5,- Eur.? I will certainly come back! Christiaan van der Eijk Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “The luxury long gone”
Reviews.Author: Ksu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in that best part of Madrid, steps away from Puerta del Sol, where you find so many hostels and hotels (to my mind, this is the only place to stay when you're in Madrid). However, hotel Ingles is not the best option in this area. It claims to be the oldest hotel in Madrid, and it still has that majestic air about it, which you associate with films based on Agatha Christie's novels. But the carpets are worn, the bathrooms are old (although I heard they have new ones on some floors), the floors and window-frames are creaky. On the bright side, the room was large (a rarity in Madrid) and the staff try to keep up the good old style. I probably won't stay there again if I have a choice but I won't run in disgust either if I don't.

Reviews.Title: “Air-conditioning does not work!”
Reviews.Author: Nataleigh
Reviews.Content: We paid extra for a "renovated" room (88 EURO a night), however, the air-conditioning temperature could not be changed in the room. It was too hot and we couldn't sleep. It was 40 degrees in madrid in June! When speaking to reception about this, the men on the desk were extremely rude and un-sympathetic about it, and simply said that the whole hotel was fixed at this temperature. Aside from the air-conditioning and the appalling service at this hotel, I would recommend it for a good location and clean rooms. I guess, it depends what is important to you...

Reviews.Title: “It was fine for us.”
Reviews.Author: ZANDVELD
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel as above average because of the circumstances. We were looking for 3 night s,at the last minute, on a busy Easter holiday week, in the center of Madrid. We tried a few favourite hotels (as well as trying to book train tickets to get to Madrid) and everything was fully booked. I found this hotel through Bookings.com for around 70 euro, a nice bargain! Thank goodness for the reviews of Trip Advisor that I can rely on to find out if we would be paying for heaven or hell. The room we were given - for around 70 euro a night - was generous in size with a nice big bed. It was all very clean, though at that time of day, when we arrived, there was a smell which seemed to be coming up from the plumbing. (It's an old hotel in an old part of town and this was understandable, especially since the odor it wasn't permanent.)Our room had to have been built in the 70's ,which I found perfectly fine; nostalgically reminding me of the first time I ever came to Madrid. Breakfast is very, very basic, but if you need something more exciting, there are plenty of great tapas bars and restaurants in that area. We found the staff - most being from South America, and NOT Spanish - neither friendly nor disagreeable. They were a bit 'dry' in character and reception. They seemed to have been hired more on keeping things organized, in order, and tranquilo in such a 'live' neighborhood than on personality and warmness. They were wary and cautious at night because the hotel is in the heart of Madrid in a 'zona de copas' which is an area with lots of clubs and bars, thus being a magnet for a lot of party animals who can often spontaneously start a 'street party'. Thus the staff is also 'guarding' this small hotel to make sure the party stays in the street. It also means that unless you ask for a room away from the street you'd be better off sleeping late when things start to get quiet. (Though you should be cautious in any big city nowadays, the area of the hotel isn't rough, just lively!) Being in the center meant that so many interesting things were accesible on foot. The metro Sevilla is very close. This hotel is recommended for those who want to take in the energy, rhythm, and feel of the city without emptying their pockets. All in all, it was a nice surprise and we will stay there again some time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel service for no apparent reason”
Reviews.Author: Nicevacation
Reviews.Content: My wife and I trusted that our travel agent books us a "good" hotel for our honeymoon. After arriving to Madrid's airport, we took a taxi to the "Hotel Ingles" and stopped at the hotel's desk to register and to ask for our room. After the paperwork was signed, I conversed with the manager, an old gentleman, in a friendly and candid manner. I told him that my wife and I just got married, and that this was our honeymoon. He replied "pedantically", and I emphasize this, for no aparent reason and in a rude tone of voice, that he is not intersted in the details of my stay there. He also added that for whatever reason I was in the hotel, that it was my business and not his. Boy, Was that rude! specially comming from a high employee of the hotel like he was. I felt insulted, and disrespected for his coldness, lack of empathy, and lack of good manners. Another desk clerck was beside him, and I was surprised and angry to see that he also approved his boss' attititude. What is wrong with these people. I did nothing to deserve his attitude. His attitude took me completely by surprise. He left me a bad impression of the Hotel Ingles and sour first impression of Spain. I only stayed that night. The time it took me to find a friendlier hotel. This is my first impression of Spain! Thank's God I discovered that the Spaniards are not as rude as this fellow.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for break in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: RoyScat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location for visiting all the sites in Madrid. We had one of the renovated rooms which are really good, the receptionists were great, they kept me upto date with all the football scores. The street was a little noisey during the early hours of the morning, but then you are smack bang in the middle of Madrid. One of the unexpected finds was the Atocha station, a really good place for something to eat after visiting the galleries. Ever wondered what happened to all your childrens art work from junior school, visit the top floor of the Picasso exhibition.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a light sleeper don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jane8855
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very near to the Prada and Thyssen museums, also short walk to Puerto del Sol (all the streets around here are very lively at night). It represents excellent value for money. Also close to Plaza Ana or Plaza Santa Ana, can't remember exact name but reviews further down mention it. This is the area where matadors used to stay and we ate at the restaurant with children's climbing frame outside. Good value for money with good food. The walls are full of pictures (both paintings and photos) of bullfights and matadors. Fortunately, I did not face any gory ones, it is possible to avoid them. Very friendly owner, worth a visit. We stayed in a room which had not been renovated (no problem with that), it was clean but very dated and in serious need of update, particularly the bathroom. The shower was actually in a sunken bath and my husband fell in it! Our room was huge but with no natural light in the sleeping area. There was a separate seating area with a further bed. One member of staff on reception was friendly but the rest ranged from so-so to dour. Not rude, but not friendly either. The worst thing about it was that the rooms are not sound-proofed at all (unless renovation includes this, I don't know). You could hear every conversation and bodily function and, to make matters worse, the corridors are all tiled so anyone coming back after you will wake you up, especially those checking in or out late as they drag their suitcases along the tiled floors. If you are a heavy sleeper or the last one back, this won't bother you. I have given above-average rating because it does provide value for money and the location is excellent. It is down a small side-street but close to museums, restaurants and interesting squares.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Cleanliness and Value.”
Reviews.Author: JD60
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Hotel Ingles late last year I had no hesitation in booking it again as my last visit was very enjoyable. As stated in my October '07 review the location is simply unbeatable. This time I was allocated room # 111 at the rear and it was so quiet and peaceful. I was pleasantly surprised at the vastness of it - 3 single beds, a seating area with armchairs and coffee table, loads of storage and flat-screen TV. Unlike my last stay, the bathroom had not been renovated and I could imagine a portly individual having some difficulty negotiating the narrow toilet area located between the shower doors and the wall. The fittings were a little dated and the layout was badly planned. This, and the lukewarm welcome and goodbye of some of the reception staff ( I can't envisage them requiring cosmetic treatment for laughter lines!!), were the only negatives in what was once again an excellent stay at Hotel Ingles. Some of the websites on Tripadvisor often quote an excellent rate of about €75-€80 per room per night. Breakfast can be included for a few Euro more. This is excellent value in the very centre of Madrid. So if you plan a visit to this lovely city with its beautiful Retiro Park and abundance of tourist attractions, don't hesitate to book this spotless, comfortable, relaxing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigcol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally situated and is close to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Santa Anna and is a short walk from Sevilla metro station. Staff are very helpful, if somewhat "dour" and there is a 24 hour reception service. Our room was spacious, clean and had everything that one needed. It had not been recently renovated (some wear marks on the wallpaper) and the bathroom furniture and plumbing is not modern, yet everything worked and the shower was hot and powerful. The beds were firm and comfortable. The heating worked efficiently (and was vey welcome!). Our room had twin beds, with a further bed in the small lounge area, separated from the bedroom by the very spacious wardrobes, that also incorporated a safe. The room door has an internal bolt. This arrangement is perfect for a couple and child. We didn't take breakfast as there are many bars in the area offering a good breakfast. The hotel represents excellent value for money. My overall view - book it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: PondCrosser
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! One staff member was friendly, the others were so-so but for the price it was great. Excellent location, near Puerta del Sol/Plaza Mayor and walking distance to many main attractions, bars and restaurants. Very safe for two young female travelers. The room was HUGE! We walked in and were angry because we thought it was hostel-like since we walked into a separate hallway and entered the room. There was one bedroom with two beds and another room with one bed. BUT it wasn't a hostel, it was a very large room!! So we have our own bedrooms, dressing areas and a decent size bathroom to share. You can sometimes hear other people walking around, walls are paper thin, but it is well worth it! Would stay here again and reccomend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay - in the end..”
Reviews.Author: Fay2
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Ingles through another website and after reading a number of reviews I emailed and requested a newly renovated room. The receptionist gave us a room which was down a rabbits warren of corridors and had no windows. I declined this room and asked for another one - again I didn't get the newly renovated one but perhaps this was a miscommunication. Eventually I got the room I was after and was very happy with it. We acknowledged that we would have to pay extra and after a little bit of haggling got the room at a reasonable rate. Receptionist was business like - not very friendly but thats fine by me. Breakfast was decent but you could probably get same in a cafe nearby. Once I got home I realised the hotel had not taken the deposit I had paid online off the invoice but after a couple of emails this too has been resolved and they have credited my account. The location is fantastic and if you get the newly renovated rooms so is the hotel. Thumbs up from me.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasKata
Reviews.Content: It was clean but take wash cloths with you. The staff isn't unfriendly but they make no special efforts either. A bit loud and located near lots of stuff. The price was average but hostels right across from the hotel as almost as nice and for about $15.00 less a night.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Crowners
Reviews.Content: We had 5 twin rooms all at the back of the hotel which very good and quiet. Excellent shower and lovely big towels. Hotel has some character, claiming to be the oldest in Madrid. Reception staff were very helpful, offering to book taxis for the airport, parking them in their garage to wait for us, and carrying our bags out. Breakfast was OK although the room had no natural light. Got a good rate through Active hotels and thought it was good value for money. Would definitely stay there again. Eating out was a bit varied. We found the best bet was the tapas bars. there were several good ones in Plaza Santa Anna which is a minute's walk away. we had one disastrous meal where we complained twice because the meals were cold and were presented with a bill for what we had had and invited to leave. I got the impression from the prices being charged and the service that some of the restaurants were becoming tourist rip offs. Lots to do - Prado etc, We went to El Escorial on the bus and and it turned out to be much better than we had thought. I preferred it to the Royal palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just noisy”
Reviews.Author: virginiatasha
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in great location. Convenient to the metro and all attractions. The hotel is surrounded by bars and restaurants, which can be very noisy until 3-4 a.m. If you book a double-bed, your room will be facing the street where all the noises are.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: emskilove
Reviews.Content: Our room was looking a bit tired but it was spotless and cleaned really well every day. In a safe area only 5 mins from the Prado and the open top bus stop (a great way to hop around madrid). Old fashioned service taken very seriously!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: FromBrazil71
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Inglés after having spent a night in a lousy place near by. For 107 Euros, not including breakfast, we had a mini suite with a sitting room and bedroom and balcony overlooking Calle Echegaray, a street with very little traffic. The Plaza Mayor, Museo del Prado and Plaza de Cibeles as well as several dining spots and the Metro are close at hand. Decent, quiet reasonably priced hotels in central Madrid are not easy to come by. So keep this old establishment on your list of possibilities & you shouldn't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located”
Reviews.Author: sue1959
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 night break. We obviously had one of the older rooms as decor basic, bathroom shabby but clean. No air conditioning double glazed but still very noisy as room faced a side street, walls of room paper thin so worth bearing in mind if you like peace and quiet. Breakfast just about adequate with no fresh juices. If you book a discounted rate I would recommend you ask for an internal room and ask for a suite, otherwise you will probably end up with our experience. Within walking distance of most of main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very Plesent stay”
Reviews.Author: benny IRL
Reviews.Content: Affordable, Quite, friendly staff and Clean. we booked 3 rooms. 1 was newly decorated, so having looked at them all the best advice is to request the new rooms on booking. Most rooms are facing an internal courtyard, which means there is not very much street noise. The street outside is narrow and has very little traffic noise. Hotel is very close (100m) to Santa Anna square which is a great spot to eat outside. The old roomsare more basic in decor. The bathroom could do with decorating but everything woked, and was perfectly clean. Breckfast is a €5 charge if you havent pre paid on booking. Beds were a bit on the small side, but overall a plesant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located, Not Cheap, Spacious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In Madrid, we made the decision to stay centrally. Our triple at the Hotel Ingles was US$170 per night, but it was spacious indeed! When a broken water main occcurred, the hotel's staff quickly helped us move to another triple where the water worked. Our room provided separate spaces for our son and us, with a door in between. The breakfast served in the nice dining room was ample. The area around the hotel is filled with restaurants and tourists. Many stores were within a couple of blocks. A good choice, but it might be quieter and less expensive to use Madrid's excellent subway system and stay a bit outside the most central area. One word about using a car, the streets leading to the Ingles are NARROW, so be sure to have your route laid out and/or a good navigator on board.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chrischennyc
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is its location. Ingles is within walking distance of all Madrid’s main attractions with the exception of the Royal Palace, which you should check to see when they are open because sometimes they may close the palace for last minute events. The hotel’s atmosphere is nothing to write home about, but most of the staff is pretty friendly. As in all the buildings in Madrid, the bathrooms are pretty old, but well kept and the water pressure is pretty good. The biggest drawback is the fact that they have no air conditioners. Good choice for a midrange hotel and you can usually book them through a last minute hotel website, ratestogo.com, for half price about a month in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very central location. Stayed in a triple...very large room with 3 single beds. Old building, but very clean from the inside. Do not look for luxury, but the very friendly and helpful staff more than compensates. Got many great pointers from them on things to do and see. Good price for room.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice hotel and good rates”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Ingles Hotel twice, and both times it was very pleasant. The location is great, and the rooms are decent and clean. Not particularly fancy or modern, but very good for the price and location.

HotelInfo.Name: Ingles Hotel
